homebuyR 0.0.1
  • Reference

    Compute Maximum Affordable Housing (Stressed DTI)

    housing_budget_from_stressed_dti.Rd

    Calculates the maximum affordable housing amount under cash-flow and debt-to-income constraints.

    housing_budget_from_stressed_dti(
  gross_monthly_income,
  other_debts,
  non_housing_essentials,
  rate_per_month,
  n_payments_total,
  savings = 0,
  income_shock_pct = 0.2,
  shock_duration_months = 6,
  max_total_dti_stress = 0.5
)

    Arguments

    gross_monthly_income

    Numeric. Gross monthly income. Must be non-negative.

    other_debts

    Numeric. Monthly debt payments excluding housing. Must be non-negative.

    non_housing_essentials

    Numeric. Monthly essential expenses excluding debts and housing. Must be non-negative.

    rate_per_month

    Numeric. Monthly interest rate. Must be non-negative.

    n_payments_total

    Integer. Total number of payments. Must be a positive integer.

    savings

    Numeric. Total savings buffer. Must be non-negative. Defaults to 0.

    income_shock_pct

    Numeric. Fractional income reduction during stress. Must be between 0 and 1. Defaults to 0.20.

    shock_duration_months

    Integer. Duration of stress period in months. Must be a positive integer. Defaults to 6.

    max_total_dti_stress

    Numeric. Maximum debt-to-income ratio under stress. Must be between 0 and 1. Defaults to 0.50.

    Value

    Numeric. Recommended maximum monthly housing amount.

    Examples

    # Gross $5000, $500 debts, $1000 essentials -> 1500
housing_budget_from_stressed_dti(gross_monthly_income = 5000, other_debts = 500, non_housing_essentials = 1000, rate_per_month = 0, n_payments_total = 1)
#> [1] 1500
